I didn't want to make a long post so:
Part 2. FALSE SWIPE is a must have. It lowers health but no matter what will leave 1hp but won't work on ghosts as it's Normal type move. Also beware pokemon with takedown or memento as they are self damaging moves and your catch had 1helth left just a second ago.
Status conditions raise the chance of capturing, but there're only 2 non damaging options- sleep and paralyze. Sleep is better out of 2 so you need hypnosis or spore move (later won't work on grass type tho). 
Classic choices for hunting that have those 2 are Gallade or Breloom ( he needs to be evolved past lvl40 to have spore from shroomish). If you have access to the Violet version get Iron Valiant.
To deal with those ghost and grass types you can use move soak to make them water type.

Quick tips then, SAVE BEFORE ENCOUNTER. If you want to catch something badly, QUICK BALL it before you do ANYTHING ELSE. 80% of the time it stays in but only on 1st move. If it breaks out try another high chance ball. Of course if you want it in a specific ball then you need to fight it.

Sometimes you can trigger a battle with a wall-stuck mons, BUT ONLY IF they are AGGRESSIVE type and charge at you on sight.
The best inventors and engineers are pragmatic-lazy in this way.

A teacher in my highschool told me once, that there are different types of laziness. Some are straight up LAZY to the point of being useless. But then there's PRAGMATIC LAZY, these people are lazy but intelligent enough to see that the problem won't disappear on its own. They find the best easiest solution to solve anything they face with minimum time/energy/resources spent and do it so it would not bother them later. I think it's a great simple example of how it works.

Any heavy CC, once she can't reach or hit you, her entire toolkit melts away. For exp Lane? Just don't push her early and play your game. If you are too far from the turret she will punish you but if she pushes too far into your turret you can punish her. In general play safe and catch her off guard in groups. She isn't that scary in TFs

I would suggest naming after the dances they represent, or places that you associate with those dances. But it might be a bit problematic with some forms like cheerleading or Japanese dance.
So maybe a combination of sorts:
-Flamenco / Andalusia, it's the easiest one, both sounds good as nemes.
-Hula / Hawaii, these are too simplistic so maybe refer to main styles of hula, 'kahiko being ancient form and modern is ʻauana.
-This is difficult. For Japanese dance (Nihon-buyō) I propose  Kabuki/Edo, but you may also use two main groups of these dances, Mai and Odori.
-Cheerleading/'Murica, this one is hardest and doesn't sound good, so maybe... first women cheerleading were from *Minnesota*, pom-pom was invented in *Texas* state, but mine preferred choice is name Courtney because they perform on court? It's hard one.

Depending on where you come from I would find a relatable comparison. 
In general it's on the same level as spicy takeaway food (excluding the likes of McDonald's or KFC which have "spicy" only in names to avoid being sued by morons).
Rather mild not much flavor in general although some like it.
If you're afraid of testing ANY spicy sauce, before testing have yoghurt and chocolate bar prepared in advance, as they negate pain in your mouth very well.
DO NOT try to wash it off with water as it will just amplify sensation.

I think both of them have access to false swipes which is essential. Moveset wise I would say that grass starter have more coverage when it comes to types of hisui pokemon, which has only few fire ones so you don't need water type that much.

You can find a decent replacement for the water starter more easily in my opinion. Even if you want to have starters of both types, when you unlock swimming on the 3rd map you'll have access to piplup there as well as turtwig in the marsh area.

Therese a cave near cortodondo (psychic gym)
Not the main big one, if you go west then jump down to the coast in the area that looks like blue and yellow eye on the map. Cave is small but can spawn salandit and salazzle. Shiny sandwich for fire or poison and some panience and you have decent chances

Please go with Vaporeon [stored power, calm mind, toxic armor and aqua ring] 
modest nature, water absorption ability, 252hp and sp.atck and as held item covert cloak to avoid poison from gunk shot.

After 3 turns it will clear stat changes on you, so "hang in there" cheer set up aqua ring and spend 3rd for whatevs. Then 3times toxic armor> 6 calm minds> all out cheer. Boss will have shield and do some double teams but it takes 3 hits of store power to kill.

If you do it online with others and they have Vaporeons already, get some support mons, I had good time with toxapex but try others by yourself.
 Good luck

Yh I see a lot of "food" comments but no one mention biggest mistake beginners do - eye contact! DO NOT STARE! Yes it sounds weird because it's little creature and it's cute, but it's BAD sign for feral cat.

Sit down nearby put food far away from you and face other direction, possibly doing LONG BLINKS like 2 seconds long. NOT LOOKING is the sign of TRUST for cats.
